item.title: On winter's coldest days, this classic Kashmiri coat offers warmth — and wisdom
item.description: In Kashmir, December 21 is said to mark the start of the 40 harshest days of winter. A woolen robe called a pheran is key to keeping warm — and a reminder of how to face and overcome hardships.

item.title: A radio station in Amsterdam is a lifeline for Sudan. After USAID cuts, it's faltering
item.description: Budget cuts threaten the future of Amsterdam-based Radio Dabanga, which has served as an information lifeline for Sudanese people about their war-torn country.

item.title: 9 killed, 10 wounded in South African pub shooting
item.description: Authorities report that nine people have died and at least 10 others are injured after a shooting at a South African pub. The incident occurred early Sunday in Bekkersdal, west of Johannesburg.

item.title: 'Congress is in a coma.' Former lawmakers sound alarm on health of the House
item.description: Congress is wrapping up the year without a lot of legislative accomplishments under its belt and a growing list of lawmakers who are retiring. Former members say the challenges on Capitol Hill have been brewing for a long time.

item.title: Russia says talks on US peace plan for Ukraine 'are proceeding constructively'
item.description: A Kremlin envoy says peace talks in Florida on a U.S.-proposed plan to end the war in Ukraine are proceeding constructively, after U.S. meetings with Ukrainian and European officials in Berlin.

item.title: North Carolina's Lumbee Tribe receives full federal recognition after 137-year effort
item.description: The Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina has finally received full federal recognition, which it has sought since 1888. Tribal leaders were moved to tears after President Trump signed the measure.

item.title: Pope Leo summons cardinals for a key assembly to help him govern Catholic Church
item.description: Pope Leo XIV has summoned the world's cardinals for two days of meetings to help him govern the church, in the clearest sign yet that the new year will signal the unofficial start of his pontificate.
